newsitem.title: TUNISIA: Tunisia raises bread price and minimum wage.
newsitem.headline: Tunisia raises bread price and minimum wage.

text.p: Tunisia on Sunday increased prices for bread, semolina and pasta and increased minimum wages as well as allowances for the poor.
The price of baguette bread (250 grammes) rose 10 millimes to 150 millimes (13 cents) while a large loaf (450 grammes) rose 20 millimes to 170 millimes.
Semolina rose 30 millimes per kilogramme to 285 millimes and flour were up 50 millimes to 375 millimes, officials said.
The price of pasta and couscous, Tunisia's main staples, increased by 40 millimes per kilogramme to 425 millimes and 465 millimes respectively.
The government simultaneously raised the minimum monthly wage in the non-agriculture sector by two dinars per month to 164.16 dinars for a 48-hour-week and 144.051 dinars for 40-hour-week.
The minimum daily wage in the agriculture sector rose by 100 millimes per day to 4.961 dinars.
The quarterly allowance for each of about 105,000 poor families and 6,000 elderly and handicapped persons increased eight dinars to 93 dinars.
